newsitem.title: USA: Barak ITC wins carrier license in Israel.
newsitem.headline: Barak ITC wins carrier license in Israel.

text.p: Barak ITC, a consortium of five companies, said Wednesday its bid for Israel's second international telecommunications carrier license was accepted by the Ministry of Communications.
The consortium consists of Sprint Corp, Deutsche Telekom AG, France Telekom, Clalcom Ltd and Matav Cable Systems Media Ltd
It will be one of two alternative carriers in the Israeli international telecommunications market that is valued at about $750 million, the companies said.

Barak will compete with the current international operator, Bezeq International, as well as a second alternative carrier bidder, to provide Israel customers with a network for the worldwide transmission of voice, data and video, it said.
The companies did not disclose the value of the carrier license.
